intro: Schizoglossum cabrae, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Schizoglossum cabrae plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
